title: Identify the Limiting Reactant
text: To determine the amount of CO2 formed, first identify the limiting reactant. Calculate the moles of each reactant using their given masses and molar masses.

title: Calculate Moles of Ethene
text: The molar mass of ethene (C2H4) is $$28.05$$ $$\frac{g}{mol}$$. Use the formula: moles $$=$$ $$\frac{mass}{molar}$$ mass to find the moles of ethene.

title: Calculate Moles of Oxygen
text: The molar mass of O2 is $$32.00$$ $$\frac{g}{mol}$$. Use the formula: moles $$=$$ $$\frac{mass}{molar}$$ mass to find the moles of oxygen.

title: Determine the Limiting Reactant
text: Compare the mole ratio of the reactants to the coefficients in the balanced equation. The reactant that produces the least amount of product is the limiting reactant.

title: Calculate the Amount of CO2 Formed
text: Use the stoichiometry of the balanced equation to calculate the moles of CO2 produced by the limiting reactant. Then, convert moles of CO2 to grams using its molar mass $$(44.01$$ g/mol).
